term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - inherent viscosity of a polymer
term.title: inherent viscosity

item.text: The ratio of the natural logarithm of the relative viscosity, η r, to the mass concentration of the polymer, c, i.e. η inh ≡ η ln = ln η r c, with which the inherent viscosity is synonymous, is the logarithmic viscosity number.

notes.item: The unit must be specified; cm3 g-1 is recommended.

These quantities are neither viscosities nor pure numbers. The terms are to be looked on as traditional names. Any replacement by consistent terminology would produce unnecessary confusion in the polymer literature.

item.alttext: η inh ≡ η ln = ln η r c
